page.title: 07All Saints Church Gt.Thurlow
page.content: All Saints Church is a pretty,flint construction in the village of Gt. Thurlow.The original church has been here since before 1066,but the building has been changed over the centuries.Possibly the oldest thing in the church is the font-11th or 12th C. but this may be a copy.The arches inside suggest that they were built in the 12th century,with a clerestory added later.One of the pews is dated 1616,and the huge wooden door with a massive key date from slightly earlier.The church has a beautiful chalice and paten made around 1650.In one of the registers, whose first entry is 1837,many names are signed"X" as the farm-workers at that time could not read or write.
